textos.texto: -This game contains images and videos that may be harmful to people with photosensitive epilepsy.
-The game will start shortly.
-Loading...
-Is it really like this?
-Yes, that's right. We're almost there.
-Normally, you don't remove viruses like this, but we're going back to the old method.
-We're going to remove it manually. Quite literally.
-I'm feeling kind of weird. So this is what it's like to enter a computer?
-Exactly. And we'll head straight to our goal: the games folder.
-We'll need to check which game has the problem first. Then we'll see how to remove the virus.
-I shouldn't have downloaded that game from an unreliable site. Everyone was playing it, and I just wanted to join in too...
-It happens. But there are consequences. It seems some other games started having issues too, so we need to investigate.
-But don't worry about that. I'll be watching from here and will help you.
-Maybe this won't be such a difficult task after all, huh...
-Let's go. I'm ready.
-Wow! We're really inside the computer!?
-You've never done this before?
-If you've never entered a computer, it might seem strange, but just press 'A' or '←' to move left and 'D' or '→' to move right.
-Being in a 2D world feels so weird...
-You can jump with 'W', 'Space', or '↑' if you want. But focus, we still need to find the virus!
-I think to continue, we need to enter that tiny door... But how?
-We're just pixels, anything is possible, try pressing 'E'!
-Whoa...
-Watch out for those holes... I can see death from here!
-A box...
-Push it by pressing 'E' all the way down. I think it'll help.
-I'll see what I can do...
-I think that's it. Everything seems calm around here.
-Let's keep searching for the virus, if we take too long, it'll only get worse. HURRY!!
-WHAT IS THAT
-I think we've gone into another game now.
-That one wasn't infected, so let's try this one.
-Remember, anything strange here could be a relevant clue.
-Is that a SLIME?
-In this game, they are EXTREMELY DANGEROUS!
-What do they do wrong?
-They will attack you. So deal with them to move forward.
-Or you can just try to dodge them and keep exploring... Whatever works.
-To attack, press 'F'.
-Is someone playing something? What song is that?
-From the sound, it seems like a guitar.
-I think I can see someone up there playing!
-What a beautiful song... Who are you?
-Good afternoon! What brings a little robot to these fields?
-I'm just wandering. Looking for something wrong, and stuff...
-Look, there's plenty wrong around here. Pleasure to meet you, I'm Jorel.
-Things are pretty calm around here, or at least they were supposed to be.
-Some of my friends told me that corruption is spreading more and more!
-Corruption?
-That's right. It seems everything is slowly disintegrating. I don't recommend going to the other side of the island.
-But if corruption is spreading, it'll reach here too.
-Yeah, I know. That's why I've been enjoying my last moments here doing what I love most...
-Look, I can help you. The corruption is on the other side, right? I can go there!
-You want to go there? How brave.
-Two or three others have already passed through these lands with the same intention, believe it or not.
-Are they okay?
-They never returned.
-The path ahead is long, and there are many challenges.
-The great cave is a watershed for those who live here. Almost no one from here can go there, and no one from there can come here.
-Anyway, if that's your intention, take this key, it'll help you start your journey.
-Thank you, Jorel! Don't worry about me, I'll be fine.
-A lever, huh?
-A key is needed to unlock it.
-When you have a key, press 'E' to activate it.
-Another lever...
-It seems the key you used there doesn't work here. I think you need to use a different one.
-But what about that HUGE cave ahead?
-The key is probably there, and so is the path to the other side.
-Uhh. It's cold here.
-No time for chit-chat, LOOK, A BAT!
-This lock looks like the one we saw up there. It needs a special key.
-Arrows?
-Well, that guy up there did say it was dangerous.
-Lives!! Cool!
-Finally out of that cave.
-You did well with that platform and the levels!
-Thanks, NYMUS!
-I don't know about you, but I'm feeling things are getting a bit weird around here.
-Are those... Glitches?
-Oh my god. What’s happening here?
-It looks like the corruption is actually glitches. They're our signs that the virus is near!
-So this virus corrupts files... It's hard to identify just from that. But one thing we know: we're on the right track.
-Looks like this is the place.
-Corrupted files, data overload...
-This virus is a big one, huh?
-I shouldn't have downloaded that game from an unreliable site.
-The only thing we can do now is try to remove it from the computer.
-Keep looking for clues.
-We're close. I can feel it.
-Another small door...
-Wasn't it from that other game?
-Yes. They were. Just like those bats and slimes.
-Things seem to be mixing up around here.
-Data overload and fusion. Maybe some polymorphic virus with code injection?
-What does that mean?
-It means it's a virus that changes every time it's injected. But that's just a theory.
-Things look tense down there.
-Anyway, you'll have to go down there to get the next key.
-I'll try!
-Everything is collapsing!
-This way. I can see it ahead. It's just over there, L3h!
-Do it. For your computer. For Jorel and all the corrupted files.
-L3h, I think I understand what's happening here.
-What do you mean, NYMUS?
-I suspected it... it's a VIRUT!!!!!
-A Virut?
-Virut is a file virus that spreads through executables.
-As I suspected, it's a polymorphic code injection virus.
-Listen carefully. I can only tell you this once.
-Virut viruses are extremely dangerous, and it will probably attack you. First, it invades your security system (Firewall).
-Your Firewall identifies standard suspicious movements of malicious files.
-So why didn't the Firewall stop it from getting here?
-That's the problem. Virut viruses are polymorphic and can change over time, bypassing Firewalls. It will likely use this against you.
-As I also mentioned, Virut infects computers through code injection. You're like a computer here. If it infects you, it could be your end.
-And lastly, Virut overloads computers, which can create data explosions that could hurt you.
-This sounds impossible. How can I deal with such a threat?
-Here's the thing. Virut has a weakness: network ports.
-Network ports are communication points that data uses to travel from one device to another. They are numbered from 0 to 65535 and track and block suspicious activity.
-Virut analyzes the ports and invades a vulnerable one, injecting code into the computer.
-How do I use this against it?

-It's simple. Just identify which network port is open and cut its connection to the Virut. When you do that, I believe it will become weak and vulnerable. Only then can we remove it from the computer with no chance of it coming back.
-I need to focus on the ports then? I'll try to cut them. I can do this.
-I'm counting on you, L3h.
-Let's cut the problem at its root!
-Oh! And you can descend from the platforms in the Virut arena by pressing 'S' or '↓'.
-I did it!! I defeated the Virut!!!!!
-L3h, I think maybe not everything went right...
I defeated it!!! Did you see?
-We arrived too late. You saw how it was already present in other games.
-But I took it down. I don't care about the other games that were corrupted, I can reinstall them later...
-I'm afraid it has gone beyond the games folder.
-L3h, you saw it. Its code spread and has probably reached every corner of your computer by now.
-But it's not here anymore. I removed it from the computer. Why does it have to be so difficult?
-I'll tell you the truth. When you defeated the Virut, I saw some corrupted files spreading frantically.
-Look, L3h, computer viruses rarely come alone. The Virut was infected with several other viruses, which by now must have infected your entire computer.
-But calm down. We've already faced the root of the problem. It's likely the viruses won't spread any further in your computer.
-But if they've already infected the entire computer, what's the difference if they're still spreading?.
-It's interesting to know because now we know that everything we remove from your computer will truly be disinfected.
-Now it's up to us to disinfect it. Completely.
-Completely?.
-Completely.
-It's going to be hard work, but fun!
-Besides, one step is already done. The games folder is clean!
-Are we going to work like an antivirus?
-Exactly! Come with me and let me help you take the first steps.
-So, the computer isn't free of viruses even after we deleted the game?
-Yeah, we couldn't stop the Virut from spreading... Now we need to find which folder the other malware is in.
-Can you identify which folders are corrupted or something?
-Of course, as an antivirus I can scan the computer for malicious files and compare them to a list of known signatures.
-Some others even use behavioral analysis to identify suspicious activities. Give me a second to scan... Done, there are these two folders left!
-My music folder?!
-Yeah. I couldn’t quite understand what’s wrong with it, but something is definitely off. Let’s get there before things get worse.
-The last one seems to be your documents folder. Let’s save that for last.
-I think this is it.
-I imagined my music folder differently.
-Anyway, you know what to do, right?
-Let’s start exploring. Looking for system errors...
-And this coin counter?
-I believe they might be useful later, but it's hard to say.
-But just in case, collect all the coins you can. You’ve got nothing to lose after all.
-What was that?
-It looks like something was trying to pretend to be a coin. But apparently, it isn’t.
-Strange... I think this might already be something caused by contamination.
-Maybe a virus pretending to be something else?
-I don’t know. But it’s really strange. Let’s try to avoid the fake coins for now.
-L3h, you won’t be able to keep going like this.
-Why not?
-The path seems to be adapting, and you don’t seem updated enough to handle these threats.
-Like any other security system, you need to be up to date to handle the latest threats.
-But leave it to me. I'll take you to the internet now. Let’s update your software.
-But I was getting so far...
-We can come back from here later. You’ll just be stronger and more adapted to handle all of this.
-Let’s go.
-We finally got out of that place. Those phishing attacks are really dangerous.
-Now you know how to use the dash. You’re ready to move forward.
-I feel more powerful!
-Have you ever heard of a Trojan horse?
-Like the one from Greece?
-That's where the name comes from. It's a type of malware that disguises itself as something harmless but, when executed, allows an attacker to access your computer and data.
-And what does it do?
-Let's say you install a game from a suspicious website and it appears to be a normal game, but once executed, an attacker can access your computer and steal your banking data.
-Wow, how can we deal with it?
-We need to be vigilant and recognize fake software.
-They always try to pose as something else. Identifying the original is always the key.
-To avoid it, we should avoid installing things from suspicious websites and always look for official and trustworthy sources, besides making backups and keeping antivirus software up to date.
-I think I'm ready. I'll try to find the original.
-We’ve arrived. We are officially in the browser.
-We’re far away from all those viruses and corrupted files, for now...
-In a way, yes.
-But it’s a big mistake to think there are no security threats on the internet for your computer.
-It’s very common for criminals to use social engineering to get your data.
-What is social engineering?
-Social engineering is a technique where criminals deceive people to obtain sensitive information, like passwords or credit card numbers.
-For example, they might pretend to be someone you trust or send messages with fake links.
-Besides that, there are other threats on the internet, like malware, ransomware, and phishing attacks.
-Phishing? I think I’ve heard of that...
-Yes, phishing is when someone tries to trick you into giving personal data, usually through fake emails or messages.
-Oh, I see. And how can I detect these phishing attacks?
-To detect phishing, it’s important to look for signs like spelling mistakes, suspicious links, and unknown senders.
-And never click on links or download attachments from emails you weren’t expecting, right?
-Most of them will be quite easy to spot since browser tools flag suspicious origins in red.
-Don’t let those red-flagged emails get you.
-But what about regular emails? Not all of them are phishing attempts...
-Those won’t be a problem for you. In fact, they might even help if they reach you. Just focus on them carefully.
-Keep moving and survive until I can finish the software update.
-Once it’s around 30%, you’ll probably have your new power.
-When that happens, press Shift to dash in any direction.
-It’ll be useful in this part.
-Until then, dodge as many phishing attacks as you can, and above all, try not to get hit by two at once.
-They will confuse you and immobilize you.
-Good luck, and remember that there may be objects ahead that will make good use of your dash.
-WARNING! Your energy core is at risk! Click here immediately to recharge your battery credits.
-Congratulations! You’ve been selected to receive a free premium software update. Enter your activation data to claim it.
-Your access to the central system has been temporarily blocked. To restore access, enter your security credentials now.
-Lucky Robot! You’ve won a golden circuit. Just confirm your security code for prize delivery.
-Alert: Your motherboard warranty is about to expire. Renew it now by clicking here and filling out your registration details.
-Urgent! Your main battery is low. Click here to schedule an emergency recharge before it’s too late!
-We’ve detected a failure in your security protocol. Update it by clicking this link to ensure your sensitive data is protected.
-You’ve just won 50% off replacement parts. Click here and enter your credentials to claim the offer!
-It was a phishing attempt, damn it.
-That hurt...
-FINALLY!!
-That Trojan horse was really dangerous...
-It sure was. That kind of virus specializes in pretending to be something else. That's why we always need to stay alert...
-Looks like the verification bar progressed. We’ve already cleaned 66% of the threats.
-So now it's just the documents folder left...
-That's right. I can detect a strong virus presence there.
-The files seem really heavy, but it's hard to say for sure.
-Let’s go!
-What a creepy place.
-I figured it would be like this. A documents folder must have a lot of mess...
-I thought it would be more organized...
-I organize my folders.
-So maybe it won’t be too hard to find the virus here.
-You know what to do. Let’s explore.
-A sign?
Orpheus' Shop
-Good afternoon, dear traveler.
-Are any of my goods of interest to you?
-The first item beside me is the Sacred Shield. It costs 5 coins.
-It will give you permanent protection.
-The middle item is the Ancient Document Sword. It costs 7 coins.
-It will strengthen your attacks from here on.
-Lastly, on the right is the Boot of the Sacred Executable. It costs 10 coins.
-It will allow you to double jump.
-Since you’re new here, take these three coins. On the house.
-Feel free to browse.
-The path ahead will be dangerous.
-Seek the four sacred digits that will decrypt the great gate.
-Be mindful, and above all, beware of the @#$%&.
-It seems censored... What was that?
The Great Temple of the Ancient Document
-I can feel the energy of this place.
-This great temple makes me believe we must make an offering.
-I can also sense the danger ahead in these hills.
-You will need to make another adaptation, but it seems you'll have to solve the temple’s riddle.
-I want to get stronger. Let’s do this!
Complete the challenge and continue your journey.
(The stone begins to tremble and a blue sigil starts to glow...)
-I feel... powerful.
You managed to recover the file. It seems to have been lost due to the corruption.
-It will be of great help to you. This driver allows you to channel your power to eliminate threats.
-It might be from an old antivirus of yours, as it seems very effective against viruses.
-Hold the 'Q' button to fire projectiles that decrypt files.
-Apparently, this shot will have three levels, depending on how long you charge it.
-I’m going to test it.
-You did great facing that thing.
-I feel like we’re getting closer to the main virus.
-I don’t know about you, but the atmosphere here feels pretty heavy, doesn’t it?
-Maybe it’s a virus that overloads files and folders... Hard to say for sure right now.
-Let’s keep moving to find more clues.
Vault code - 8241
-I found the code! Now I think we’re all set...
-WORMS are very dangerous. They’re known for replicating endlessly until they exhaust your computer’s memory.
-We have to get out of here immediately. This whole place is going to be ruined in seconds.
-In other words: RUN!
-I’ve already written the code down on your screen.
-Phew...
-Good thing I managed to escape in time...
-I think we failed the mission...
-The documents folder was completely corrupted by the worms.
-But what now? What should we do??
-In cases like this, there’s no way out. The only thing we can think of doing is to minimize the damage.
-What do you mean?
-The documents folder must be deleted immediately.
-But that’s not a problem since we have backups to help us.
-Backups?
-Backups are saved versions of your files that can be restored even after losing them.
-You made the backup, right?
-I can’t believe it...
-How was I supposed to know???
-That’s the thing. You can’t know...
-That’s why you have to back up regularly!!!
-I understand, I understand... I’ll start backing up my computer from today.
-I’m deleting your documents folder now. I’ll do it before the worms proliferate to the rest of the computer.
-And with that, I think we’ve completed the cleaning of the computer.
-Look, we saved most of the documents. I think we had a positive outcome then.
-For sure. I’ll be much more careful with digital threats from now on.
-Yes, that’s very important.
-Virut, Trojan horse, phishing, worms, file viruses...
-These that we saw are just some of the many threats that exist in the digital world.
-That’s why we need to always stay updated on this.
-Got it. Let’s get out of here now, I can’t take it anymore...
-I can’t wait to use my computer again!
-Let’s go!
-Thanks for playing NYMUS!
Maded by Purrfect Studio:
